content.description: Another moderate with two ways to go mid way up, with some unique colored rock. Rock quality is not all the best.
content.location: Second route in the area. (middle of the three moderates)

content.description: Start with a reachy boulder problem that leads into rest section. Next is a small roof with chossy rock that leads into easier climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Stick clip  recommended, 8 bolts with  two ring anchors
content.location: If taking the Goat Trail, turn left at the bottom and take ~3 min walk. Look for a tall pine at the base of a cave and you will find the first bolt.

content.description: Simple straight up route to warmup on or hang from to get blood flowing for the Cottontop boulder.  Topout is dirty but the hold is big enough to not be an issue.
content.location: South of the Voodoo Wall and the Roof in Neverland.  Park in the Neverland lot, hike down and right a short distance.  It's near the bottom of the bluff, with Cottontop 30-40ft away.

content.description: Sitstart near or on the start for "Cottontop", with the slot and pocket, or slightly further in if reach isn't quite there.  Come out to the crimp rail and then up right to a solid full hand pocket.  Hit some left holds to get your feet set and top out center of the boulder, near the finish of "Cottontop".  2-3 pads and a spotter because the landing, while not very cluttered, is a solid decline.
content.location: The boulder is wedged in a runoff near the Voodoo wall.  Park at Neverland, head down and to the right.  It's on a lower tier of the bluff, and "Juicebox" is very close as well.

content.description: Sit start on a right pocket and left slot on the bottom left of the boulder.  Move up through the left side of the boulder, either reaching the jug and pulling straight to the horn, or slapping left on the eret to the top.  Topout isn't bad, crimps up top.  2-3 pads and a spotter.  Landing area isn't too cluttered, but it's a decline, so spotter is just there if the climber rolls off the landing, or blows a hold.
content.location: The boulder is wedged in a runoff near the Voodoo wall.  Park at Neverland, head down and to the right.  It's on a lower tier of the bluff, and "Juicebox" is very close as well.

content.description: Route closest to the arete of the three.

Crux is probably near the start where you have to do a very dynamic throw to a two-finger pocket on pretty blank face. continue upwards towards a funky right leaning dihedral, and use an optional drop knee to go over and finish.
content.location:
Located at the bottom of the 4th class scramble/rope down (past the climb-down approach to the main Jamestown area) 

  Also located secluded from the other three routes in this area. You need to follow the bluff line right another couple of minutes to find the sneaky entrance to this great climb.

content.description: Crimps and decent face climbing to the top
content.location: Route closest to the corner the bluff line makes.

content.description: This area seldom sees any traffic because of its seclusion. Rock quality is fairly good, especially for Magic Carpet Ride.    Receives shade most of the day.
